availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ira B. Hutchison (Lawrence Co., captain 68th Enrolled Militia )

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, soldier. Virginia native. Married to Louisa P. Hutchison. Father of Leonidas H. Hutchison, George T. Hutchison, and William Hutchison. Clerk in store in Louisa, Kentucky, in 1860. Captain of the 68th Kentucky Infantry Regiment Enrolled Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to July 23, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 661.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 284B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0469.
Find A Grave, "Ira Burton "IB" Hutchison (1833-1905)," Memorial #188167959 , http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/188167959 (accessed January 5, 2021).
